August 13, 2024
EMAIL ONLY: matt@agricolalaw.com
Mr. Matt Holdren
Agricola Law
127 South 8th Street
Opelika, AL 36801
RE: Gilliland v McGregor
Case No.: 70-DR-2023-900051.01
Dear Matt:
My client has posed several concerns regarding your proposed order. First, if the
reunification counseling requires my client’s attendance, we will have to take into
consideration that he has a job and cannot just leave at any given time. If the
reunification counseling does not involve my client, I am assuming that your client will
make transportation arrangements for said counseling. Secondly, if I remember the
Judge’s comment correctly, he mentioned Wednesday as an example but said he did
not care if the time spent with your client was breakfast, lunch, or dinner. There are a
number of activities that AK has at times that conflict with a set date. The parties must
be flexible in order to make sure that a meal during the week works for everyone’s
schedule. And last, Brittany was recently invited over to my client’s home to see the kids
and to take pictures before they left for their first day at school. The entire time she was
there, she held her phone camara up for the purpose of recording everyone. This
behavior is obviously not conducive to a good working relationship, and we request that
she reframe from said behavior in future visits.
If we cannot reach a mutual agreed upon proposed order, I suggest that each on
of us file our own Order with the Court, so that the Court can determine which one can
be enforced.
Sincerely,
TOM F. YOUNG, JR.
TFY/cc
